primary_diagnosis.description: Major depressive disorder, recurrent episode, moderate
primary_diagnosis.justification: History confirms multiple prior depressive episodes without intervening mania or hypomania, consistent with recurrent MDD. The patient's presentation, requiring recent antidepressant initiation (*Sertraline* start 4 weeks ago) and causing continued functional impact, meets the criteria for moderate severity, as confirmed by clinical consensus.
dsm_criteria_met: A1: Depressed mood and/or loss of interest/pleasure (inferred by treatment start)
A2: Five or more associated symptoms present during the same 2-week period (inferred by treatment start)
B: Symptoms cause clinically significant distress or impairment
C: Not attributable to physiological effects of a substance or another medical condition

ruled_out.reason: The patient explicitly denies any history of manic or hypomanic episodes, ruling out Bipolar I or Bipolar II Disorder.
